news.title: Belvedere Teachers College dominates ZTCOSA games in Bulawayo
news.content:
Story by Mthokozisi Dube
BELVEDERE Teachers College ruled the roost at the Zimbabwe Teachers College Sports Association games which ended in Bulawayo this Tuesday.
The road to the annual Zimbabwe Tertiary Institutions Sports Association Games began with teachers college games held at Hillside Teachers College in Bulawayo.
Belvedere Teachers College scooped 18 gold medals, nine silver and four bronze to emerge overall winners, while hosts, Hillside held on to second spot position with nine gold medals, seven silver and four bronze.
ZTCOSA president, Andrew Moyo said they had to increase their competition dates to have ample time to select the best athletes for the ZTISU games happening between 24 and 27 June in Bulawayo.
“We had a successful competition and we are happy that this time, our principal allowed us more days for athletes to effectively compete. We want to assemble a strong team which will represent us at the ZITISU games. We are also introducing beach soccer this time around.”

news.title: Zvishavane Taekwondo athlete preparations raring to go
news.content:
Story by Courage Bushe
A talented Taekwondo athlete from Zvishavane, Nathaniel Brown is confident of leaving an indelible mark at the Wuxi 2025 World Taekwondo Championships to be held in China in October this year.
The 19 year old Southern Africa big Championships 2023 gold medallist, Nathaniel Brown, is leaving no stone unturned in his quest to raise the country’s flag high at the Wuxi Taekwondo World Championships set for China in October.
Competing in the 80kgs category, the Zvishavane based athlete will take his preparations to Eswathini next month, where he will compete with regional athletes.
Brown says he is looking forward to bringing home some gold medals.
“We have been training hard for the past three months, and I am happy that everyone is raring to go. Next week, I’m leaving for Mozambique for a one week training with Master Itai before I go to Eswathini for a preparatory tournament next month. For the world Championships, I’m raring to go, and all I’m looking forward to is to come back home with some silverware,” he said.

news.title: Tarryn Leigh de Souza tournament unearths new tennis talent
news.content:
Story by Mthokozisi Dube
NOW in its 15th year, the annual Tarryn Leigh de Souza tournament held in honour of the late tennis star returned with a bang at two venues in Bulawayo this Monday.
From the dust streets of Emakhandeni, Emakhandeni High School student, Courage Ndlovu bagged gold in the under-16 category of the tournament.
The rising star believes the win is a step in the right direction as he prepares to improve rankings in the upcoming ITF tournaments set for next month.
“This is my third time featuring in this tournament. I have put enough preparations and I am happy I have won it before the ITF tournaments. I want to get better by each tournament and I am happy for myself,” winner, Courage Ndlovu said.
Makanaka Hwata got it right after winning in the under 18 boys category in a tournament she lost in the semi-finals last year.
Regina Zibowa triumphed in the girls under 18 category, while Minenhle Moyo was victorious in the under 16 category.
“It is a good platform to shine. We had stiff competition but I am happy I have made it,” a winner said.
“I started badly but had to bounce back. I am happy for the comeback and I look forward to the upcoming ITFs,” another winner said.

news.title: Exciting premier league matches lined up for Easter holidays
news.content:
Story by Anashe Murombedzi, Sports Reporter
THERE will be no Easter break in the Castle Lager Premier Soccer League this year as several matches are lined up this holiday.
24 hours after the much anticipated Uhuru Cup clash between FC Platinum and Simba Bhora in Gokwe, attention shifts to Castle Lager Premier Soccer League action when Green Fuel hosts ZPC Kariba in a delicately poised encounter.
Three matches are lined up for Sunday when Manica Diamonds host TelOne at Sakubva, while Triangle clashes with Yadah in the Lowveld and CAPS United Welcome Bikira Minerals at Rufaro.
Easter Monday is packed with log leaders, MWOS set to play their first topflight match at their upgraded home ground, Ngoni Stadium in Norton.

news.title: Unlikely pacesetters defy expectations
news.content:
Story by Anashe Murombedzi, Sports Reporter
NORTON-based side, MWOS, have become unlikely pacesetters in the Castle Lager Premier Soccer League after shooting to the top of the log.
Had it not been for a window that came for Norton-based side, MWOS to acquire a ZPC Hwange franchise, the current Castle Lager Premier Soccer League log leaders would have been playing in the Division One league.
MWOS’s journey to the Premiership was not a walk in the park as they finished last season as Northern region runners-up losing the title to Scotland Football Club, but found an alternative route by acquiring the ZPC Hwange franchise.
Getting into the top flight, MWOS have done extremely well occupying the top spot with 14 points, a point above Ngezi Platinum.
They kicked off the season with a 1-0 victory over Highlanders, followed by a draw with Bikita Minerals and wins over Yadah and FC Platinum.
The Punters are proving to be the early pacesetters, unbeaten in six matches and riding high in confidence.
Billy Veremu has been a key player, scoring three goals, including two headers.
Another star for MWOS so far this season is Salif Cheya, who scored the winning goal against Highlanders in their debut match.
Lloyd Mutasa has led his charges effectively, and goalkeeper Martin Mapisa has been instrumental with four clean sheets in five appearances.
MWOS’ strong frontline is complemented by a solid defence, making them a force to be reckoned with.
